document_data.caption: A beholder zombie.
document_data.name: Beholder zombie
document_data.language: Understood [[Deep Speech]] and [[Undercommon]] but couldn't speak
document_data.mainbody: '''Beholder zombies''' were powerful [[zombie]]s created from the reanimated corpses of dead [[beholder]]s with the use of [[Necromancy|necromantic]] magic. Unlike the despotic [[death tyrant]]s, they were mindless servants and retained no memory of their living selves.
document_data.Description: Beholder zombies were decrepit and decayed, rotting corpses that barely resembled their original form. They could still hover but many of their eye rays were non-functional.
document_data.Combat: Like normal zombies, beholder zombies were hard to keep down, mindlessly attacking anything in sight. Those who created them could give them simple orders to make them harder to face, but without these commands their attacks were entirely random. Their orders would need to be in [[Deep Speech]] or [[Undercommon]] so that they could be understood. The only rays still functional were paralysis, disintegration, enervation, and fear. It could use any of these at random, or attempt to bite living beings.
document_data.Notable Beholder Zombies: In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], the [[Xanathar's Thieves' Guild]] employed a beholder zombie to perform raid missions in [[Waterdeep]].
